Untitled
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Poetry: Untitled
By King952 on Saturday, May 15, 2004 - 10:47 am:

She hasn’t counted
Since last Friday
All those times her heart’s been broken

All those broken promises
Way, too many unshed tears
Them damned fiends, all preying on her fears

One, she thought a God
Followed him home
He’s never there, and she’s not alone

The innocent is heard the least
Heartache is all she meets
Tainted love, heart of stone, and she’s no longer alone

She thought him a God
Now she’s his *****
Followed him home, he ****ed that *****

Fated decided
Set in stone
Now she can do nothing, because she followed him home

God to Dog
And she his *****
She’s the Evil, their child to Live

She hasn’t counted
Since last Friday
All those times her heart’s been broken

By Icelord13 on Saturday, May 15, 2004 - 11:19 am:

Wow...depressing. Only a few minor errors here and there such as you dont need a comma after One and the last line of the second stanza would sound better as Those instead of Them. Very nice work of art, however, a title would be helpful. Maybe something that adds to the depressing atmosphere of this piece.
